message: How does the PCDS 2030 plan aim to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians, and what specific strategies or initiatives are outlined to support this goal?
response: Thinking… (click to collapse) I will research the PCDS 2030 plan for social inclusivity details. Key constraints include limited information on specific initiatives. Assuming the plan outlines strategies for all Sarawakians, I'll find them. I’ve performed an information search and found the following: The PCDS 2030 plan aims to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians by implementing various strategies and initiatives. Some of the specific initiatives outlined in the plan include: Bantuan Khas Sarawakku Sayang (BKSS) packages: The Sarawak Government has implemented nine BKSS packages, totaling RM6.7 billion, to alleviate the financial burden of the people and business community during the COVID-19 pandemic. These packages include cash assistance, discounts on utility bills, fee waivers, and deferment of payment for land premiums and loan schemes. Endowment Fund Sarawak (EFS): The EFS provides a grant of RM1,000 in the form of savings for every Sarawakian baby born starting from 2019, to assist with higher education, starting a career, or as seed capital for small businesses. Special Annual Grant for Early Childhood Education Institutions: A grant of RM5,000 is allocated to Early Childhood Education Institutions registered in Sarawak to provide quality care, guidance, and education. Kenyalang Gold Card: A special card for Sarawak senior citizens aged 60 and above, providing facilities such as special discounts, free membership, and other benefits. Bantuan Pesakit Buah Pinggang: An initiative to ease the burden of kidney patients, especially those from low-income groups, by covering costs such as AV fistula insertion, Erythropoietin injections, and hemodialysis treatments. Launching Grants for Entrepreneurs: A launching grant of RM5,000 is provided to welfare aid recipients to join the entrepreneurial field. Female Head of Household Assistance (KIRWaS): Assistance in the form of cash, amounting to RM500, is provided to single mothers and female heads of households from disadvantaged groups. Affordable Housing: The Sarawak Government has implemented various schemes, such as Rancangan Perumahan Rakyat (RPR), Rumah Mampu Milik (RMM), and Rumah Spektra Permata (RSP), to provide affordable housing for the B40 and M40 groups. Housing Deposit and Repayment Assistance Scheme: A scheme to support first-time homebuyers in the B40 and M40 income groups, providing financial assistance to
